Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Ming Êòé> Imaging one day people start using hard wallet like smart phone now. I mean hard wallet having network connection for storing, swapping and transferring only which less security vulnerable than smartphone.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> I think the thought process for hardware wallets is that you store funds there and then lock them away for long periods of time. You wouldn't want to carry it around everywhere for the risk of being mugged and forced at gun point to unlock your wallet (though there are duress pins for that) but still. (re @Ming Êòé: Imaging one day people start using hard wallet like smart phone now. I mean hard wallet having network connection for storing, swapping and transferring only which less security vulnerable than smartphone.)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> mobile phones can likely be good "hardware" to store on just like the current wallet apps, so long as the app is sufficiently encrypted and protected. but having your private keys on a mobile device with internet, wifi, bluetooth, cell signal, hot spot, etc is already worrisome enough. I only have "walking around money" on my phone wallets :D

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in a bear market BTC is sold for fiat, less BTC available to be on the books for alts, but more needs to be sold due to lower price, which exaggerates the altcoin losses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are in a BTC dominance up cycle, which tends to last for some weeks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but when it turns, it turns nearly instantly
